title: Payment made for another 37,500 MT diesel shipment
body_lines: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) says that a payment of USD 52 million has been made to a Singaporean company for 37,500 metric tonnes diesel in a tanker held at Colombo Port for the last two weeks.
CPC chairman Sumith Wijesinghe said that unloading of the fuel stocks will commence tomorrow (April 07).
